alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 12:10AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock, western Holt, eastern Keya Paha and western Boyd Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Wewela to 12 miles southwest of Rose. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bassett, Spencer, Atkinson, Stuart, Butte, Chambers, Newport, Naper, Rose, Amelia, Emmet, Dustin, Burton, Anoka, Twin Lakes State Wildlife Management Area, Hull Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Duff, Mariaville, Mills and Brocksburg. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 150 and 182. Highway 20 between mile markers 255 and 303. Highway 281 between mile markers 222 and 223. Highway 12 between mile markers 64 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
